fields.summary: Need to add a warning for the Epic issue deletion

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Setup Application Link between JIRA (http://localhost:8080) and FishEye/Crucible (http://localhost:8060)
# Change JIRA Base URL to be http://jira.domain
# Application Navigator in FishEye/Crucible showing the link to JIRA server with the URL http://localhost:8080

Atlassian Navigation Links Plugin needs to be upgraded to version 3.3.1 as stated in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-4698
fields.summary: Application Navigator not using the Base URL

fields.description: I don't know JQL, and rely on JIRA informing me, as I type, if I'm making any silly mistakes with my query. And it usually works great! I came across this instance in which the little icon indicated all was well with my JQL, but a notification dialogue informed me that my JQL was invalid!
fields.summary: JQL is sometimes validated as correct but parsed as incorrect

fields.description:
As soon as a Workflow is edited using the Diagram Editor (HTML5), all Recursive Global Transition are converted into many Step Transitions.

The interest of Global Transition is to keep in only one place.

I can understand that JIRA editor does not provide all OSWorkflow features , but it is very practice to keep existing settings.

It was the case with other editor (Text, Diagram in Flex).
fields.summary: The Workflow editor (Diagram) convert Recursive Global Transitions into Step Transitions
Ability to filter dashboards on a project

Looks like the culprit is probably a JavaScript exception that causes an AJAX request to be made with junk data. {{com.atlassian.jira.plugin.issuenav.service.issuetable.DefaultIssueTableService#getIssueTableFromIssueIds}} should check that {{ids}} isn't empty, before it gets to {{AbstractIssueTableCreator}} and causes an exception to be thrown.

We want something like this in {{com.atlassian.jira.plugin.issuenav.service.issuetable.DefaultIssueTableService#getIssueTableFromIssueIds}}:

{code}
if (ids.size() == 0) {
    final ErrorCollection errorCollection = new SimpleErrorCollection();
    errorCollection.addError("ids", "ids must not be empty");
    return new ServiceOutcomeImpl<IssueTableServiceOutcome>(errorCollection);
}
{code}
fields.summary: /rest/issueNav/1/issueTable/stable throws exception under high load
Java API returns back a stale reference to an issueTypeScreenScheme even after it's been deleted
Missing Release Notes and Upgrade Notes in Download and Try JIRA page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38323].
  {panel}

On the default Close Issue screen, the field labeled Time Spent requires a value, even though the field (known as Log Work in the Field Configuration) is marked as optional.

When you try to close an issue, it forces you to type in a value.


h4. Steps to Reproduce
Ticket has the following:
* Resolve/Close screen has "Log Work" field listed

# Create a Bug (or any other issue)
** Ensure that "Remaining Estimate" has a value set greater than 0.
# Resolve the Issue (or Close issue)
# On Time tracking - *set the Remaining to 0*.
# Now click on "Resolve" (or Close) transition.
# Error indicating that Time Spent is required

h4. Expected Behaviour
JIRA leaves the Time Spent field alone, as no time needs to be logged.

h4. Extra Notes
* This problem occurs regardless of having Legacy mode enabled/disabled.
* If  a screen has both "Log Work" and "Time Tracking" fields listed, "Log Work" will override the "Remaining Estimate" field.

h4. Workaround
# Have the transition automatically set the Remaining Estimate to 0 for the Resolve/Close transitions:
** https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Set+Remaining+Estimate+to+0+on+post+function
# Use the issues Edit functionality to set the Remaining Estimate to 0, instead of using the transition.
fields.summary: Time Spent Required even though marked as optional

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38320].
  {panel}

We have just started using the "Build and Deploy" functionality of JIRA, and so far we are quite happy with it.  One minor piece that seems to be lacking is a "next release" version number.

Lets say we have the following versions setup in JIRA:
1.0.0 - (released)
1.0.1 - Bug fixes (released)
1.0.2 - Bug fixes (current dev version, not yet released)
1.1.0 - Feature release
... etc, etc...

When we "Build and Release" 1.0.2, the default settings of the maven release plugin will set the next snapshot to 1.0.3-SNAPSHOT, when what we really want is 1.1.0-SNAPSHOT.

Yes, we could create an empty bamboo variable for the "next release" number, then override it when we trigger the build, but that can introduce human error.

Since JIRA knows that the next version in the list is 1.1.0, it would be nice if it could supply that number as a variable (similar to bamboo.jira.version).

I was actually quite surprised to see there wasn't a ${bamboo.jira.nextVersion} variable available.
fields.summary: Add a "next version" variable for use in Bamboo release plan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38315].
{panel}
h3. +Summary+

In JIRA, *View Development Tools* permission determines which users can view development-related information from integrated applications. Integrated applications here include those listed in JIRA Administration -> Applications -> Integrations:
 * Bitbucket Cloud and Github/Github Enterprise - as DVCS Accounts
 * Bitbucket Server (formerly Stash), Bamboo, Fisheye/Crucible - as Application Links
 * Perforce - Integration to create Perforce jobs from JIRA issues

(i) Subversion is also included - in the form of the Subversion tab in JIRA issue view

(!) This means, those users that have [View Development Tools permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-remove-or-edit-access-to-development-panel-701268686.html] can view everything, while those without the permission can view nothing. Currently this permission is configurable per project via Permission Scheme.
h3. +Use Case+

In many cases, for a specific project, an admin would like a user to be able to create Perforce jobs, but not to view Bamboo builds. Similarly another user might see Crucible reviews but not view Github commits. It's not possible to have this flexibility as of now.
h3. +Suggestion+

It would be great to have one or more permission/s that could restrict access to specific applications only, not all. For example, View Development Tools permission could be split for multiple applications:
 * View Development Tools:
 ** Bitbucket Cloud
 ** Github/Github Enterprise
 ** Bitbucket Server
 ** Bamboo
 ** Fisheye
 ** Crucible
 ** Perforce
 ** Subversion

h3. +Notes on Perforce+
 * A user with the permission can create a Perforce job from a JIRA issue and see "Perforce job exists" as the value of the Perforce Job field. A user without the permission, when viewing the same issue, will see the value of the field as "You do not have permission to view the job details".
 * On the other hand, when a user without the permission attempts to create a Perforce job from a JIRA issue, the job is indeed not created but the user sees "You do not have permission to view the job details", which confuses him/her. When a user with the permission views the same issue, he/she sees "Perforce job exists", but no job actually exists for the issue.
fields.summary: More Permission Options for Development Tools.

  {panel}

The documentation for the REST call for adding a user to a group is complete.

Published Docs: https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/6.2.4/#d2e939

In the documentation it says that it adds the "specified user to the specified group".  Its clear how to specify the group, but not the user.

The solution was found here:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/255778/need-an-example-for-add-user-to-group-function-in-jira-rest-api-6-1
fields.summary: JIRA REST documentation for "add user to group" incomplete

fields.description:
# In an LDAP directory, create a group called 'spaces ' (the word spaces with *with* a space at the end). Make sure JIRA has not grou called 'spaces' (the word spaces *without* space at the end).
# Attach JIRA to that LDAP directory.
# Try and add the 'spaces ' group to a project role. You will get an error:
!spaces.png!

Looks like the UI is trying to add the group 'spaces' when it should be trying to add 'spaces '.

h4. Workaround

Please remove any trailing spaces from the group value in the LDAP Directory to avoid this situation.
fields.summary: Can't add group with trailing spaces to a project role.

fields.description:
h3.Symptoms
LDAP synchronisation fails with the following error in {{atlassian-jira.log}}:

{code}
2014-03-05 06:30:15,246 QuartzScheduler_Worker-1 INFO      [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory] failed synchronisation complete for directory [ 10000 ] in [ 12ms ]
2014-03-05 06:30:15,667 QuartzScheduler_Worker-1 ERROR      [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingDirectoryPoller] Error occurred while refreshing the cache for directory [ 10000 ].
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Passed List had more than one value.
    at org.ofbiz.core.entity.EntityUtil.getOnly(EntityUtil.java:62)
    at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizInternalMembershipDao.isDirectMember(OfBizInternalMembershipDao.java:85)
    at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizInternalMembershipDao.isGroupDirectMember(OfBizInternalMembershipDao.java:80)
    at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizDelegatingMembershipDao.isGroupDirectMember(OfBizDelegatingMembershipDao.java:70)
    at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.AbstractInternalDirectory.isGroupDirectGroupMember(AbstractInternalDirectory.java:711)
    at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.AbstractInternalDirectory.removeGroupFromGroup(AbstractInternalDirectory.java:768)
    at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations.removeGroupMembershipsForGroup(DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations.java:879)
    at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DirectoryCacheImplUsingChangeOperations.syncGroupMembersForGroup(DirectoryCacheImplUsingChangeOperations.java:145)
    at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.AbstractCacheRefresher.synchroniseMemberships(AbstractCacheRefresher.java:149)
    at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.AbstractCacheRefresher.synchroniseAll(AbstractCacheRefresher.java:84)
    at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.UsnChangedCacheRefresher.synchroniseAll(UsnChangedCacheRefresher.java:124)
    at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.synchroniseCache(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:644)
    at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectorySynchroniserImpl.synchronise(DirectorySynchroniserImpl.java:63)
    at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingDirectoryPoller.pollChanges(DbCachingDirectoryPoller.java:50)
    at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.monitor.poller.DirectoryPollerJob.execute(DirectoryPollerJob.java:34)
    at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:195)
{code}

h3.Diagnosis
* This error happens when there are multiple mappings for User to Group to Directory for the same user due to database inconsistency.

h3.Resolution
Please see the knowledge base article [LDAP directory fails to synchronise with error "Error occurred while refreshing the cache for directory" | https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=528482338] which provides SQL queries to confirm and fix the inconsistencies.

fields.description:
If websudo is enabled on an instance and you go to, say, Advanced Configuration, you can only edit things for around two minutes. If you're inactive for 2+ minutes, websudo will require you to re-authenticate. Sadly, RestfulTable isn't naturally aware of websudo -- if an API returns 401, restfultable just does nothing, providing no feedback to the user whatsoever.

We need to do one of two things:

h4. Cheap but fair option
If an action returns a 401, present the user with a message telling them to refresh to reauthenticate with websudo. Let them know the data they just entered won't be remembered.

h4. Humane option
If the action 401's,

# keep the request data handy
# pop up a modal dialog explaining they need to reauthenticate with websudo to complete the action.
# provide the websudo form in the dialog.

If they authenticate successfully, 
# Show a message saying they're re-authenticated, and
# re-send their request.

If they cancel the re-authentication, redirect them to a sensible page they have access to see (probably wherever websudo already directs people to).
fields.summary: RestfulTable should play nicely with WebSudo

fields.description: h4.how to reproduce: # goto administration -> issues -> prorities # edit a priority # paste the following data-uri snippet inside the "icon URL" input: {code} data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAIAAAP8AAAAAACH5BAAAAAAALAAAAAAQABAAAAIOhI+py+0Po5y02ouzPgUAOw== {code} # click on "update" # goto an agile board (or any other display of tasks) # select a card with the updated priority # right click on the empty image -> inspect element (Chome) h4.expected: {code:html} {code} h4.actual: {code:html} {code} ---- This behavior is inconsistent throughout the whole system.. sometimes it's a relative path (i.e. broken) sometimes it's an absolute path (i.e fine). *see the attached image.*

Hi,

So, I know this is not where Jira was build for, but I'm trying to get our animation development in to a Jira board.

Now, for instance, only the post production of an animation already consists out of 19 components (see attachment 1). If I then make a board out of it, it will look something like attachment 2. 

Guess what I'm asking is, is there a way to have a scroll in the screen instead of having it cropped like it does now?

Thank you.

Need ability/permission to see group memberships

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38275].
  {panel}

*Note*

This issue is not replicable thus far, however, there are cases reported having the same behavior. 

*Issue Symptom*

Project created, seen in the list of project in project administration page, but when trying to access or delete. It is presented with error message:

{noformat}
No project could be found with key $projectkey
{noformat}

No visible error in the logs, just some information stating after the redirection to the project page:
{noformat}
current-@400000005370d5d333c303c4 2014-05-12 15:08:09,856 TP-Processor15 ERROR user 908x449316x2 esy4ek 141.0.34.138,131.103.27.100 /rest/project-templates/1.0/templates [jersey.spi.container.ContainerResponse] Mapped exception to response: 500 (Internal Server Error)
current:@400000005370d5d333c30b94 javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No local entity with key 'projectkey' and type 'class com.atlassian.applinks.application.jira.JiraProjectEntityTypeImpl' exists
current-@400000005370d5d333c30f7c 	at com.atlassian.jira.projecttemplates.rest.ProjectTemplatesResource.createProjectFromFormRequest(ProjectTemplatesResource.java:125)
current-@400000005370d5d333ca0c8c 	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
{noformat}

*Suspect:*

Some interruption (maybe network) causing the project creation to halt. But there is not enough information in the logs that might determine that.

*Workaround*

If you are using *JIRA Cloud*, please raise an issue at support.atlassian.com, with a date and time that you would like a restart to occur. Support will grab the logs and restart the instance to resolve the problem.

If you are using *JIRA Server* the following [KB Article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Project+Becomes+Corrupted+After+Project+Key+is+Changed+or+New+Project+is+Created] lists work around methods to attempt.

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:

1) Create one issue with description and Due Date. 
2) Navigate to Project -> Browse Project page -> Calendar.
3) Go to the Date in Calendar which is specified in Due Date for issue.
4) Hover the mouse pointer over the issue.

Expected Result:
The issue type icon of the issue should be displayed along with Issue Key, Summary and Description.

Actual Result:
The issue type icon of the issue is not displayed.

Note: 
The issue type icon is not displayed in the JIRA Issues Calendar gadget also.

The Issue Key and the Summary should be displayed in the grey background when mouse pointer is hovered over issue.

Functionality seems to work fine in version 1.19 of JIRA calendar plugin. In Version 2.1.7 of JIRA Calendar plugin it is not displaying.

PFA the screenshots in the attached document for reference.
fields.summary: The issue type icon is not displayed when the mouse pointer is hovered over the issues in Calendar for Calendar plugin.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38266].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

1) Navigate to a project
2) The Browse Project page is displayed, Click on Create Issue button.
3) The Create issue popup is displayed with 'Configuration Fields' and 'Create another' check box.
4) Navigate to Project Admin Page and click on Create Issue.

Expected Result:
Create issue Popup needs to be displayed.

Actual Result:
The Create issue page is displayed instead of Create issue Popup.

To have consistency over the create issue functionality, we suggest that there should be single popup of the Create Issue displayed when clicked on the Create issue button and the 'Configuration Fields' and 'Create another' check box should be present in the popup.
fields.summary: Enhancement: The Create Issue popup is not displayed when clicked on Create Issue button from Project Admin Page.

h3. Problem Definition
The DB monitoring page can be very helpful for identifying when problems may have occurred with the db pool. However what can happen is the log will rotate out and we can't go back far enough for diagnosis.

h3. Suggested Solution
Please extend the timeline of the log so that it can have additional archival information.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38260].
  {panel}

h4. Justification
# Adding the Resolution field to Default Screen will allow user to set resolution during issue creation, which is not appropriate. 
# It will conflicts with the default _Unresolved_ value in JIRA. The result; statistics in Issue Navigator and/or gadgets might show incorrect data.
# User might have also added another value called Resolution and confuses themselves - [Defining Resolution Field Values|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+Resolution+Field+Values]
# Bulk editing the resolution field could be a lengthy process - [JRA-7302|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-7302]
# Others: [*JRA-30902*: Setting Resolution Upon Issue Creation does not Work|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-30902]
fields.summary: Do not allow user to add Resolution field to Default Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38254].
  {panel}

When creating or editing an issue we have the Sprint field as an option on our screens. Atlassian has recently updated this field to display the "Sprint Name" we give the sprint rather than the "Sprint ID". Great idea, but we need this improved.

We have several development teams that all have their own Agile board. All issues fall under the same project, but are divided up to teams based on ownership of the components of our product. These teams all run in the same sprint cadence. For example (see attachment), each scrum team will be starting "Sprint 10" next week.

So now when a user goes to update the Sprint field they see several "Sprint 10" options, but it is unclear on which Sprint the issue should be added to. This forces us to drag and drop on the plan board, rather than simply adding it to the appropriate sprint when an issue is created.

I would propose that the Sprint field displays the following:

<<Sprint Name>> - <<Agile Board>> (Active Sprint or Future Sprint)

Using this format will make it very clear on what Sprint the issue should be added to if all the Sprints in our organization are named the same thing.
fields.summary: Update Sprint Field to Display Agile Board Next to Sprint Name

fields.description:
Frequently, myself and other users on our system are noticing that "Filter Results" dashboard gadgets are not reflecting the actual filter results
* I have built a filter (assignee = me AND status != closed AND resolution = Unresolved) and saved it to my favorites.
* In my dashboard, I've added the filter results gadget to display the aforementioned filter's results 
** I frequently see lots of issues listed which are no longer assigned to me (they were briefly)
** I also see issues listed which were closed as much as 24 hours ago
* When I click "Issues" menu at top, then click on my filter, the results in the issue navigator are correct
** NONE of the issues listed by the filter in issue navigator view are showing up as "Closed" or assigned to someone besides me.... but in the dashboard gadget they are.

Again, this appears to be a lag between the actual filter results and the gadget display of said results...

NOTE- My dashboard filter results gadget is set to refresh every 15min, but this doesnt happen
* If I refresh the gadget manually, I also see no changes.
fields.summary: JIRA "Filter Results" dashboard gadget not updating according to settings

Hi,

i using the last Jira release 6.2.x

in the incoming email, to create a new issue when i send a mail, i have a problem of format with Content-type : HTML
- So if a send i email from Outlook as HTML format, in JIRA (mail handler) see it as TEXT/PLAIN :(

- But if i send a email from GMAIL as HTML format, in JIRA (mail handler) see it as HTML format :)

Do you know why from outlook the email HTML are "converted" as TEXT content type ?

i make several test with the sys admin, and may be the problem is from Outlook ... (but our outlook is standard), we don't force to convert email to text/plain

Many thanks
Alexandre
fields.summary: Incoming email from Outlook

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Replicate
Access the following two links (two queries on JAC):
* [project = JIRA AND resolution WAS Unresolved AFTER -7d|https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?jql=project%20%3D%20JIRA%20AND%20resolution%20WAS%20Unresolved%20AFTER%20-7d], and;
* [project = JIRA AND resolution WAS EMPTY AFTER -7d|https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?jql=project%20%3D%20JIRA%20AND%20resolution%20WAS%20EMPTY%20AFTER%20-7d].

h3. Current Behavior
In JIRA 6.2, the "Unresolved" synonym for "EMPTY" with the resolution field is not working as expected (this problem only occurs with the historical operators, i.e. WAS, WAS NOT or CHANGED)

h3. Expected Behavior
The JQL queries should return the same results.
fields.summary: JQL history queries using resolution field does not translate "Unresolved" to "EMPTY"

fields.description:
Richard found the following issue/bug with JIRA:

If you are assigned an issue and add a comment to it the reporter gets an email. If he emails back the email shows up in the comments, like expected. 
But if you add a comment and change the assignee then if the reporter responds to the post it gets lost in never land. Since it looks for the original assignee and never finds it. I did this on 8 or 10 items today that would have been lost had Phi not emailed me to see if I wanted to proceed with comments I made to him in email.

So if a JIRA issue is assigned to you and you have a question, I suggest that you leave it assigned to you and the reporter will get an email of your question, but we do not always want to do this.

Basically the actual comment is lost and never makes it to JIRA on a specific project that we currently have.
fields.summary: Comments Left on Issues that Never Make it to JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38232].
  {panel}

At the Create Issue screen, if you have different context for different projects for the same custom field, changing the project does not update the custom field default value accordingly.

*Steps to reproduce*
Have at least two projects
Create a custom field and add it to the default screen (tested with URL and Text (single line) types)
Create different context for each project
Edit the default value for each context (use different default values to notice the difference)
Reindex and return to JIRA's home page
Click the Create issue button and check the default value
Change the project and see that the default value won't change according to the previously configured context.

*Workaround*
After selecting the new project, hit "Esc" on the keyboard or click "Cancel" to close the create issue screen, then click the Create issue button again. Do this everytime you need to change the project.
fields.summary: Custom field's default value does not get updated if the project is changed at the Create Issue screen
Make the issue cog menu in JIRA gadgets available when using the same gadgets within confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38230].
  {panel}

Many companies have multiple projects for different groups, divisions etc and need to have similar dashboards and filters run. Presently, we have to create a new filter for each dashboard/project. 

It would be a nice feature if you could use some-type of project option in the filter definition which will look at the current project/dashboard and reflect that in the results. Maybe even have an option at the top of the dashboard that allows selection of project?

This would allow definition of far fewer filters for larger companies which would share common dashboards and filters. 

Maybe you could introduce something similar to currentuser(), i.e. currentproject() in the JQL definition of the filter?

The other option - dashboard project dropdown would allow you to influence the entire dashboard based on a project being picked - this could automatically change the currentproject, so that both options work.

Just think how many filters companies create (likely also atlassian) which could be reduced with this method.
fields.summary: Re-usable filters at project level
Make it possible to use service desk in combination with subdomains

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38224].
  {panel}

h4.Symptom
In JIRA Project Summary, the following tables display "No issues" for the following sections/tables:
* "Unresolved: By Priority"
* "Unresolved: By Assignee"
* "Unresolved: By Issue Type"

!Project-Summary.png|thumbnail!

h4.Cause
* The "Resolution" field is not indexed
* This could happen when the field configuration has the field "Resolution hidden" and hence it is not considered during indexing.

h4.Resolution
# Browse to the affected project's Administration > Issue Types 
# For each Issue Type, repeat the following steps (if they use a different Field Configuration)
#* Under column "Field configuration," click on the "Field Configuration" used for each Issue Type
#* Scroll to the "Resolution" field and click on "Show" link on the left-most column to enable display of this field.
# Make sure that all the "Field Configurations" are updated.
# Browse to Administration > System > Re-indexing and do a "Lock JIRA and rebuild index"
fields.summary: Project summary for unresolved issues is empty when resolution is hidden in field configuration

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*

# Create a project with any user as the Lead
# Rename the username for the project Lead
# Go to project administration and click Edit Project
# Change the Project Key
# Click Update

*Expected Results*
Project is updated

*Actual Results*
# Nothing happens, no error messages as well.
# Nothing in logs

*Workaround*
# Change the Project Lead to an user who has not been renamed
# Make the Project Key Edits
# Revert Project Lead back to original user
fields.summary: Project Key Edit is broken if the Project Lead Is A Renamed User

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38218].
  {panel}

We are tuning a large JIRA instance with some performance issues.  One of the suggestions on the [JIRA Performance Tuning|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Performance+Tuning] page recommends replacing "jira-users" with "Anyone" in project permission schemes.  Unfortunately making this change would mean that some content would be accessible to unauthenticated users.

Is it possible to bypass the heavy duty permission checks by:
# Using a global "Require Login" setting together with the existing "Anyone" group alias.
# Creating a "Authenticated User" group alias, similar to "Anyone".
Either of which would simply check for a valid authenticated session?

Option 1 is attractive as it would enable a system administrator to easily make a system wide change.

I hope you are able to implement something to address this performance issue while still allowing systems to require authentication.
fields.summary: Create global "Require Login" setting

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38217].
  {panel}

Setting
The user is creating a new bug or story in Jira. 

Observed
If the user fills out some or all of the text fields in the new issue and then goes back to the top of the page and changes the "Project" or "Issue type", all data that was previously entered is erased. This is a terrible user experience and a major hassle to have to retype the case over again. The only data that is retained are the attachments. Please fix this.

Expected
Under no circumstances should any data on the page be erased without the user explicitly deleting the data themselves. Changing the Project or Issue Type at the last minute will not delete or affect the text in any of the data fields. 

STR:
1. Access Jira 
2. Click "Create Issue" on the Jira toolbar.
3. Begin filling in all data fields with text.
4. Go back to the top of the issue that you are drafting and change the "Project" to something else on that drop-down menu.
5. Notice that all of your type data has been erased.
6. Repeat the steps above, only this time change the "Issue Type" to something else on the drop-down menu.
fields.summary: Changing "Project" or "Issue Type" will delete all text.

fields.description:
I am working on Jira SDK 6.1.6 to develop a plugin connecting to MicroSoft Web services, in Eclipse with java (1.6) everything goes fine to connect to the MS Web Services.
Did debug the web service call to see if the request is able to find the com.sun.xml.internal.ws.api.streaming.XMLStreamReaderFactory in Eclipse, and yes was able find from "rt.jar" (in JRE/lib folder, Java default implementation).

When tried to deploy the same plugin (developed) into Jira instance downloaded from the URL (http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download) 64 bit windows instance.
(Jira instances 6.1.5, 6.2.3 and 6.2.4 versions, Same error on all the 3 versions).
After deploying the plugin get the Initial error: 
javax.xml.stream.FactoryFinder$ConfigurationError: Provider com.ctc.wstx.stax.WstxInputFactory not found
                at javax.xml.stream.FactoryFinder.newInstance(Unknown Source)
                at javax.xml.stream.FactoryFinder.findJarServiceProvider(Unknown Source)
                at javax.xml.stream.FactoryFinder.find(Unknown Source)
                at javax.xml.stream.FactoryFinder.find(Unknown Source)
                at javax.xml.stream.XMLInputFactory.newInstance(Unknown Source)
                at com.sun.xml.internal.ws.policy.sourcemodel.XmlPolicyModelUnmarshaller.createXMLEventReader(Unknown Source)
.
.
.

And after refresh the browser get the error:
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class com.sun.xml.internal.ws.api.streaming.XMLStreamReaderFactory
	at com.sun.xml.internal.ws.wsdl.parser.RuntimeWSDLParser.createReader(Unknown Source)
	at com.sun.xml.internal.ws.wsdl.parser.RuntimeWSDLParser.resolveWSDL(Unknown Source)
	at com.sun.xml.internal.ws.wsdl.parser.RuntimeWSDLParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at com.sun.xml.internal.ws.wsdl.parser.RuntimeWSDLParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at com.sun.xml.internal.ws.client.WSServiceDelegate.parseWSDL(Unknown Source)
	at com.sun.xml.internal.ws.client.WSServiceDelegate.<init>(Unknown Source)
.
.
.

Attached are the files with complete stack trace.

Extracted the rt.jar from Jira installation path (<installation_folder>\Atlassian\JIRA\jre\lib\rt.jar) Even though the JRE/lib contains the com.sun.xml.internal.ws.api.streaming.XMLStreamReaderFactory class, but not available at run time.

Had a look on 
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-26214
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-27669
and tried to read the documentation how to use the workaround as in URL (https://bitbucket.org/fakraemer/confluence-smithereens/src/aa131c174b24/src/main/java/com/atlassian/confluence/plugins/smithereens/DefaultXmlFactoryFacade.java?at=refactoring#cl-27) which does not exist!

Help would be greatly appreciated for any workaround or fix to deploy the plugin into Jira instance.

--Thanks
Manjunath
fields.summary: Error java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class com.sun.xml.internal.ws.api.streaming.XMLStreamReaderFactory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38210]. {panel} I've just used the Send-Email function for the first time, and been bitterly disappointed. I typed out an important message for JIRA users and sent it as HTML, only to discover that it stripped out all of my paragraph breaks, making the email effectively unreadable. I've had to send out another copy of the message using
tags. After seeing the HTML format did not work correctly, I tried sending a plain-text test email to myself, and for that one JIRA simply sent all of the XHTML markup as plaintext, for even more unreadable garbage! So please: 1. Retain line breaks in HTML mode. 2. Fix plain-text mode to actually send the plain-text entered by the user, not plain-text of the entire email form.
fields.summary: Using Send-Email from system panel, strips paragraph breaks from HTML mode, plain-text mode sends HTML code

fields.description:
I was working with the JJUPIN plugin, running a SIL post function script that caused my JIRA site to crash. I rebooted the server but now alot of the JS nav menus won't work.

Some reported issues:

- The navbar menus for Dashboards, Projects, and Issues no longer appear, however the FAQ, Cog, and Profile menus work.

- Some users say the color of the header bars (on gadgets and the navigation bar) are now red instead of the color set by us (blue).

-On the create issue screen, the assignee autosuggest box no longer works

The issues all seem to be js or css related. Other than that site functionality is fine (users can create, edit, transition issues).

One browser console errors comes up: Uncaught ReferenceError: JPT is not defined

Anybody ever see this before?
fields.summary: Site crashed, after server reboot JS/CSS issues
